title: Oliver Cromwell's letters and speeches: with elucidations.
author: Cromwell, Oliver
snippet: I rest,Your servant,Oliver Cromwell. fThe base of Oliver's ' Dunbar Peninsula,' as we have called it(or Dunbar Pinfold where he is now hemmed in, upon ' an entanglement very difficult'), extends from Belhaven Bay on his right,to Brocksmouth House on his left ; ' about a mile and a half fromsea to sea.' Brocksmouth House, the Earl (now Duke) of Roxburgh's mansion, which still stands there, his soldiers now occupyas their extreme post on the left.
